Client:
Butcombe Brewing Co.

Work:
ReBrand & visual architecture across entire product range.

An extensive creative redevelopment for the renowned brewery, we shaped a new strategic narrative, defining and creating opportunities for category growth. Forged a complete revolution of visual identity and design for the traditional ale portfolio and created an subbrand & design architecture for a specialist, limited edition craft beer range.

Request a case study

The Butcombe brand is beloved and respected by fans of traditional British ale across the UK & beyond. Halo immediately got straight to the heart of the brand, understanding our unique proposition with their impressive consumer insights and commercial approach. The results speak from themselves. Halo have revitalised the brand, created new revenue streams & opened up markets for us in a way we hadn’t thought possible. Emmy Webster, Marketing Director

Dolor sit amet

The shift in the consumer pallete towards punchier, heavy hopped IPA’s & mature Bocks has created space in the category for Butcombe’s seasonal, special edition brews. Each one is limited batch with a unique name & design created in honour of a landmark event or personality from 1978 - the year of the Brewery’s birth. The ‘78 Range has achieved significant retail listings & On-Trade support.

Creating original craft and sub-brand stories

A range to celebrate all the things we missed whilst making Butcombe Original

The shift in the consumer pallete towards punchier, heavy hopped IPA’s & mature Bocks has created space in the category for Butcombe’s seasonal, special edition brews. Each one is limited batch with a unique name & design created in honour of a landmark event or personality from 1978 - the year of the Brewery’s birth. The ‘78 Range has achieved significant retail listings & On-Trade support.

1978 saw the release of Space Invaders, the arcade game that changed the world with its iconic game play and design. Today, it remains a totem for a generation, taking us back to a simpler time, where saving the universe came in 8-bit and a handful of small change could last you the night. To celebrate this game changer, we’ve created a beer that’s a classic in its own right.

They called the winter of ‘78 ‘the winter of discontent’. Widespread strikes across the public sector brought the country to a standstill as workers fought for their rights. To mark this tumultuous period of British history, we’ve created a beer for the people.
